page.title: 03YOUTH FACILITIES, THATCHAM.
page.content: The youth organisations met in Kennet School in May to discuss the lack of facilities for the young in Thatcham. It was felt that the needs of young people were not being met.Many new houses are being built without any facilities for the young.A B.M.X.track and a swimming pool were suggested. Leaders agreed that Kennet School could benefit more people by becoming a community centre.Some organistions find the hiring costs too high. Dr. Wheeler-Robinson headmaster, was happy for the school to be used more,whilst agreeing that the cost was enormous. Kennet School is used as a centre for evening classes in Thatcham, a youth club meets there three times a week. The sports hall is used by Thatcham people at weekends and the hall by local music and drama societies.
